history.proof: intros p0 p1 n. intros H1 H2. apply pl_tl_length_prod. auto. auto.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (p0 p1 : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length p0 n -> pl_tl_length p1 n -> pl_tl_length (pl_produit p0 p1) n

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
pl_produit = fun pl0 pl1 : prec_list => pl_produit_1 pl0 (pl_essence pl0 pl1) pl1 : prec_list -> prec_list -> prec_list
Inductive prec_list : Set := prec_cons : ad -> prec_list -> prec_list -> prec_list | prec_empty : prec_list
Inductive pl_tl_length : prec_list -> nat -> Prop := pl_tl_O : pl_tl_length prec_empty 0 | pl_tl_S : forall (a : ad) (pl : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length pl n -> pl_tl_length (prec_cons a pl prec_empty) (S n) | pl_tl_propag : forall (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length la n -> pl_tl_length ls (S n) -> pl_tl_length (prec_cons a la ls) (S n) For pl_tl_length: Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope] For pl_tl_S: Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope _] For pl_tl_propag: Argument scopes are [_ _ _ nat_scope _ _]
pl_tl_length_pl_compat : forall (p0 p1 : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length p0 n -> pl_tl_length p1 n -> pl_compat p0 p1
pl_product_0_invar_essence : forall (p0 p1 : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_essence p0 p1 <= n -> pl_produit_1 p0 (pl_essence p0 p1) p1 = pl_produit_1 p0 n p1
pl_product_0 : forall p0 p1 : prec_list, (forall (a : ad) (l : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_essence p0 p1 <= n -> pl_produit_0 a p0 p1 (pl_essence p0 p1) l = pl_produit_0 a p0 p1 n l) /\ (forall n : nat, pl_essence p0 p1 <= n -> pl_produit_1 p0 (pl_essence p0 p1) p1 = pl_produit_1 p0 n p1)
pl_produit_0_incr = fun p0 p1 : prec_list => forall (a : ad) (l : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_essence p0 p1 <= n -> pl_produit_0 a p0 p1 (pl_essence p0 p1) l = pl_produit_0 a p0 p1 n l : prec_list -> prec_list -> Prop
pl_produit_1_incr = fun p0 p1 : prec_list => forall n : nat, pl_essence p0 p1 <= n -> pl_produit_1 p0 (pl_essence p0 p1) p1 = pl_produit_1 p0 n p1 : prec_list -> prec_list -> Prop
s_produit_0 : forall (s0 s1 : state) (c : ad) (p0 p1 : prec_list), MapGet prec_list s0 c = Some p0 -> MapGet prec_list s1 c = Some p1 -> MapGet prec_list (s_produit s0 s1) c = Some (pl_produit p0 p1)
pl_tl_length_prod : forall (pl0 pl1 : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length pl0 n -> pl_tl_length pl1 n -> pl_tl_length (pl_produit pl0 pl1) n
Inductive prec_contained : prec_list -> prec_list -> Prop := prec_id : forall p : prec_list, prec_contained p p | prec_c_int0 : forall (p p0 p1 : prec_list) (a : ad), prec_contained p p0 -> prec_contained p (prec_cons a p0 p1) | prec_c_int1 : forall (p p0 p1 : prec_list) (a : ad), prec_contained p p1 -> prec_contained p (prec_cons a p0 p1)
pl_compatible_compat : forall p0 p1 : prec_list, pl_compatible p0 p1 -> pl_compat p0 p1
prec_contained_ind : forall P : prec_list -> prec_list -> Prop, (forall p : prec_list, P p p) -> (forall (p p0 p1 : prec_list) (a : ad), prec_contained p p0 -> P p p0 -> P p (prec_cons a p0 p1)) -> (forall (p p0 p1 : prec_list) (a : ad), prec_contained p p1 -> P p p1 -> P p (prec_cons a p0 p1)) -> forall p p0 : prec_list, prec_contained p p0 -> P p p0
mpl_compat = fun s0 s1 : state => forall (c : ad) (p0 p1 : prec_list), MapGet prec_list s0 c = Some p0 -> MapGet prec_list s1 c = Some p1 -> pl_compat p0 p1 : state -> state -> Prop
pl_tl_length_ind : forall P : prec_list -> nat -> Prop, P prec_empty 0 -> (forall (a : ad) (pl : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length pl n -> P pl n -> P (prec_cons a pl prec_empty) (S n)) -> (forall (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length la n -> P la n -> pl_tl_length ls (S n) -> P ls (S n) -> P (prec_cons a la ls) (S n)) -> forall (p : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length p n -> P p n
pl_tl_propag : forall (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length la n -> pl_tl_length ls (S n) -> pl_tl_length (prec_cons a la ls) (S n)
pl_produit_path_incl_2 : forall (pl0 pl1 : prec_list) (n : nat) (plp0 plp1 : pl_path.pl_path), pl_path.pl_path_incl plp0 pl0 -> pl_tl_length pl0 n -> pl_path.pl_path_incl plp1 pl1 -> pl_tl_length pl1 n -> pl_path.pl_path_incl (pl_path_product plp0 plp1) (pl_produit pl0 pl1)
pl_tl_S : forall (a : ad) (pl : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length pl n -> pl_tl_length (prec_cons a pl prec_empty) (S n)
pl_compat_check_complete : forall (p : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_compat_check p = Some n -> pl_tl_length p n
pl_compat_check_correct : forall (p : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length p n -> pl_compat_check p = Some n
Inductive pl_tl_length : prec_list -> nat -> Prop := pl_tl_O : pl_tl_length prec_empty 0 | pl_tl_S : forall (a : ad) (pl : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length pl n -> pl_tl_length (prec_cons a pl prec_empty) (S n) | pl_tl_propag : forall (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length la n -> pl_tl_length ls (S n) -> pl_tl_length (prec_cons a la ls) (S n) For pl_tl_length: Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope] For pl_tl_S: Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope _] For pl_tl_propag: Argument scopes are [_ _ _ nat_scope _ _]
pl_path.pl_path_incl_length : forall (plp : pl_path.pl_path) (pl : prec_list) (n : nat), pl_path.pl_path_incl plp pl -> pl_tl_length pl n -> pl_path.pl_path_length plp = n
pl_produit_path_incl_4 : forall (pl0 pl1 : prec_list) (n : nat) (plp : pl_path.pl_path), pl_path.pl_path_incl plp (pl_produit pl0 pl1) -> pl_tl_length pl0 n -> pl_tl_length pl1 n -> exists plp0 plp1 : pl_path.pl_path, plp = pl_path_product plp0 plp1 /\ pl_path.pl_path_incl plp0 pl0 /\ pl_path.pl_path_incl plp1 pl1
pl_path.liste_rec_length : forall (pl : prec_list) (tl : term_list) (d : preDTA) (n : nat), liste_reconnait d pl tl -> pl_tl_length pl n -> n = lst_length tl
pl_tl_length_rec_6 : forall (d : preDTA) (pl : prec_list) (tl : term_list) (n : nat), pl_tl_length pl n -> liste_reconnait d pl tl -> n = lst_length tl
pl_path.forall_incl_length : forall (pl : prec_list) (n : nat), (forall p : pl_path.pl_path, pl_path.pl_path_incl p pl -> pl_path.pl_path_length p = n) -> pl_tl_length pl n
iad_conv = fun a0 a1 : ad => match a0 with | 0%N => match a1 with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p1 => N.pos (iad_conv_aux_0 p1) end | N.pos p0 => match a1 with | 0%N => N.pos (iad_conv_aux_1 p0) | N.pos p1 => N.pos (iad_conv_aux_2 p0 p1) end end : ad -> ad -> ad
pl_produit_rec_3 : forall (d0 d1 : preDTA) (tl : term_list) (pl0 pl1 : prec_list) (n : nat), liste_reconnait (preDTA_produit d0 d1) (pl_produit pl0 pl1) tl -> predta_compatible d0 d1 -> pl_tl_length pl0 n -> pl_tl_length pl1 n -> (forall u : term, term_list_occur u tl -> forall (d2 d3 : preDTA) (a0 a1 : ad), predta_compatible d2 d3 -> reconnaissance (preDTA_produit d2 d3) (iad_conv a0 a1) u -> reconnaissance d2 a0 u /\ reconnaissance d3 a1 u) -> liste_reconnait d0 pl0 tl /\ liste_reconnait d1 pl1 tl

```coq
intros p0 p1 n.
intros H1 H2.
apply pl_tl_length_prod.
assumption.
assumption.
Qed.```
This proof is quite straightforward. It simply applies the `pl_tl_length_prod` lemma, which states that if `pl0` and `pl1` have the same length `n`, then their produit also has length `n`. The two hypotheses `H1` and `H2` provide the necessary premises for this lemma.

original: intros p0 p1 n. intros H1 H2. apply pl_tl_length_prod. auto. auto.
